resources.string: To report a power outage, type the following characters and press report.
Please enter in the name and phone number of your utility company before reporting an outage.

GridWatch is a collaboration between the University of Michigan Lab11 and the University of California Berkeley. This app is currently in public beta and is not fully functional. Check out our website for more information: http://grid.Watch:8088 .
Characters Did Not Match! Report Not Sent!
Characters Did Not Match! Data Not Deleted!
Not on the Internet. Can\'t Load Map!

Not on the Internet. 

 Will delete data on next connection! 

 When your data is deleted, you will receive a notification. 
 Additionally, the time the data was deleted will be shown in the settings screen.
We think there might be a power outage in your neighborhood. Is your power on?
No! My Power Is Not Out!
Are you sure you want to delete your data? \n This can not be undone. \n Please consider the value your data has for researchers in your area.
To delete your data enter the code below.
Would you mind telling us why you deleted your data? You can leave this blank if you want.
You can change any settings later in the settings menu in the app.
e.g. 100 Main Street, Ann Arbor, MI, USA
Number of Estimated Outages a Week
Estimated Average Outage Duration in Hours

"GridWatch is a participatory sensing platform and a research project led by the University of Michigan.

 GridWatch is designed to crowd-source the sensing of power outages and power restorations. This will build a dataset that will help ensure that the power you are provided is reliable by both helping the utility companies better serve you and by helping researchers understand how the power grid is performing, leading to new innovations. 

 All data collected by GridWatch is collected in order to increase the accuracy in which the app can sense power outages and restorations. For a walkthrough of the sensing methodology, please go to http://grid.watch. 

 Data collected can include; network metadata, cellphone metadata, audio, location, acceleration and other sensor readings. The GridWatch app allows for location sampling to be opted out of at anytime. 

 Through the GridWatch app, you are able to view and delete all personal data collected by GridWatch. When you request your data to be deleted in app, you will receive confirmation of the deletion in app. 

 By consenting below, you grant the University of Michigan and its research partners the right to publicly release all of all data gathered by this app, after this data have been made to be anonymous. 

 The University of Michigan and its partners agree to not seek any profit from the collection of this information. 

 For any questions, please contact gridwatchdev@gmail.com."
GridWatch helps you report power outages to your utility company.
It gives you a button to report an outage with one click.
It also automatically senses outages. Let’s walk through how this works.
Step 1: When your phone is charging and then stops, GridWatch realizes there might be an outage.
Step 2: GridWatch looks to see if you have unplugged your phone by checking to see if it has been shaken.
Step 3: GridWatch listens for hum from nearby electrical power or generators.
Step 4: If GridWatch can’t hear any hum, it sends a report over the Internet to the GridWatch analysis center where it is relayed to your utility company!
GridWatch uses only 200 Bytes of data per report. This is about as much as 1 SMS
Watching a couple YouTube videos will have more drain on your battery life than GridWatch will in a year.
All the information GridWatch gathers is made available for free. \n\n You can see it at www.grid.watch
You are able to remove your personal data and control how GridWatch senses at any point through this app.
We encourage you to read more about GridWatch here. \n\n This is a project from the University of Michigan, the University of California and IBM Research Africa.
Ooooops ! I crashed, but a report has been sent to my developer to help fix the issue !
An unexpected error occurred forcing the application to stop. Please help us fix this by sending us error data, all you have to do is click OK.
You might add your comments about the problem below:
Token retrieved and sent to server! You can now use gcmsender to send downstream messages to this app.
An error occurred while either fetching the InstanceID token, sending the fetched token to the server or subscribing to the PubSub topic. Please try running the sample again.
Location is used to search chat rooms.
Location is used to give you local content.

Global GridWatch chat. To subscribe to a topic, hold the topic name until text turns green. To unsubscribe, hold the topic name until text turns gray. You automatically subscribe to topics you create.
